first_reading.text:
[[Is 25,6]]On this mountain the LORD of hosts will provide for all peoples a feast of rich food and choice wines, juicy, rich food and pure, choice wines.
[[Is 25,7]]On this mountain he will destroy the veil that veils all peoples, The web that is woven over all nations;
[[Is 25,8]]he will destroy death forever. The Lord GOD will wipe away the tears from all faces; The reproach of his people he will remove from the whole earth; for the LORD has spoken.
[[Is 25,9]]On that day it will be said: "Behold our God, to whom we looked to save us! This is the LORD for whom we looked; let us rejoice and be glad that he has saved us!"
[[Is 25,10a]]For the hand of the LORD will rest on this mountain.
first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah

gospel.text:
[[Mt 22,1]]Jesus again in reply spoke to the chief priests and the elders of the people in parables saying,
[[Mt 22,2]]“The kingdom of heaven may be likened to a king who gave a wedding feast for his son.
[[Mt 22,3]]He dispatched his servants to summon the invited guests to the feast, but they refused to come.
[[Mt 22,4]]A second time he sent other servants, saying, 'Tell those invited: "Behold, I have prepared my banquet, my calves and fattened cattle are killed, and everything is ready; come to the feast."'
[[Mt 22,5]]Some ignored the invitation and went away, one to his farm, another to his business.
[[Mt 22,6]]The rest laid hold of his servants, mistreated them, and killed them.
[[Mt 22,7]]The king was enraged and sent his troops, destroyed those murderers, and burned their city.
[[Mt 22,8]]Then he said to his servants, 'The feast is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy to come.
[[Mt 22,9]]Go out, therefore, into the main roads and invite to the feast whomever you find.'
[[Mt 22,10]]The servants went out into the streets and gathered all they found, bad and good alike, and the hall was filled with guests.
[[Mt 22,11]]But when the king came in to meet the guests he saw a man there not dressed in a wedding garment.
[[Mt 22,12]]He said to him, 'My friend, how is it that you came in here without a wedding garment?' But he was reduced to silence.
[[Mt 22,13]]Then the king said to his attendants, 'Bind his hands and feet, and cast him into the darkness outside, where there will be wailing and grinding of teeth.'
[[Mt 22,14]]Many are invited, but few are chosen."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

psalm.text:
[[Ps 23,1]]The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
[[Ps 23,2]]In verdant pastures he gives me repose; 
beside restful waters he leads me;
[[Ps 23,3a]]he refreshes my soul. 

[[Ps 23,3b]]He guides me in right paths
for His names's sake.
[[Ps 23,4]]Even though I walk in the dark valley 
I fear no evil; for you are at my side 
with your rod and your staff 
that give me courage.

[[Ps 23,5]]You spread the table before me 
in the sight of my foes; 
You anoint my head with oil; 
my cup overflows.

[[Ps 23,6]]Only goodness and kindness follow me 
all the days of my life; 
and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD 
for years to come.
psalm.title: Psalms

second_reading.text:
[[Ph 4,12]]I know indeed how to live in humble circumstances; I know also how to live with abundance. In every circumstance and in all things I have learned the secret of being well fed and of going hungry, of living in abundance and of being in need.
[[Ph 4,13]]I have the strength for everything through him who empowers me.
[[Ph 4,14]]Still, it was kind of you to share in my distress.
[[Ph 4,19]]My God will fully supply whatever you need, in accord with his glorious riches in Christ Jesus.
[[Ph 4,20]]To our God and Father, glory forever and ever. Amen.
second_reading.title: Letter to the Philippians
